dog_facts.fact: Dogs can learn over 100 words, but they still pretend they don’t hear 'bath'.
A dog’s sense of smell is so good, they know what you had for lunch yesterday.
Dogs dream just like humans — probably about endless belly rubs and stolen snacks.
Some dogs can run faster than cheetahs… at least in their dreams.
When dogs kick after pooping, they’re not covering it up — they’re marking their territory in style.
Your dog thinks every delivery person is a potential threat to national security.
Dogs tilt their heads to look cute — and it always works.
The average dog can make you happier faster than a cup of coffee.
Dogs don’t care if you talk to yourself, as long as treats are involved.
Golden Retrievers were bred to retrieve things — like your socks, whether you asked or not.
Dogs have about 1,700 taste buds, but still eat things they find on the sidewalk.
A wagging tail doesn’t always mean happiness — sometimes it’s just high-speed communication.
Dogs can smell fear, which is why they chase joggers who run away screaming.
Some dogs snore louder than humans and have no shame about it.
Dogs don’t have a concept of time, but they always know when dinner is late.
Dogs invented the puppy eyes look to win arguments with humans.
Your dog has no idea what a selfie is but will photobomb every one of them.
Dogs can recognize their owners by smell alone, even after years apart — or one shower.
A dog’s wet nose helps it absorb scent chemicals, and also makes for perfect nose prints on windows.
Corgis were bred to herd cattle, but now they mostly herd humans to the couch.
Dogs don’t sweat like humans — they pant dramatically instead.
Your dog probably thinks 'fetch' is a human training exercise.
Dogs can sense when you’re sad — and then sit on your lap until you feel better.
Beagles were once bred for hunting, now they hunt crumbs under the dining table.
Dogs can be left- or right-pawed, just like humans are left- or right-handed.
Some dogs love baths — others act like you’re attempting a murder.
Dalmatians are born completely white — their spots appear later, like freckles after vacation.
Dogs are one of the few animals that genuinely enjoy being hugged.
The phrase 'dog tired' came from observing dogs after zoomies.
Dogs can hear four times better than humans — especially the sound of cheese wrappers.
Some dogs have eyebrows expressive enough to win Oscars.
Dogs often sleep in a ball to protect their organs — or because the blanket is too small.
If dogs could text, 90% of their messages would be about food.
Dogs can tell when you’re lying — especially if it’s about going to the park.
Chihuahuas have the biggest personalities per square inch in the animal kingdom.
A Greyhound could outrun a cheetah over distance — but it would stop halfway for a nap.
Dogs can actually laugh — it just sounds like heavy panting.
Dogs love routines so much, they think weekends are a personal insult.
Some dogs are terrified of vacuum cleaners — because clearly, it’s a monster.
Your dog thinks you’re a magician every time you open the fridge.
Dogs can understand your tone better than your words — especially if you use the 'treat voice'.
A dog’s tail is a built-in mood indicator — no batteries required.
Dogs don’t understand mirrors — they just think there’s another dog who refuses to play.
Some dogs roll in smelly stuff because it makes them feel fashionable.
Dogs have been humans’ best friends for over 15,000 years — and they still haven’t gotten bored.
Dogs wag their tails in different directions depending on their emotions — science says so!
Your dog has no idea how big or small it is — that’s why Chihuahuas bark at Great Danes.
Dogs love squeaky toys because it mimics the sound of their prey — and your sanity breaking.
No matter how many toys you buy, your dog will still prefer your slipper.
Dogs can detect diseases, but mostly they just diagnose you as 'needs more snacks'.

cat_facts.fact: Cats think knocking things off tables is performance art.
Cats sleep up to 16 hours a day — they call it 'power napping,' humans call it 'lazy'.
When your cat blinks slowly at you, it's their way of saying 'I tolerate you'.
Cats don’t fetch — they subcontract that work to dogs.
Cats only meow at humans — it’s their custom ringtone for us.
When your cat shows you their belly, it’s not always an invitation — it’s a trap.
Cats groom themselves 50% of the day and judge your hygiene the rest of the time.
Your cat sits on your laptop because it’s warm and because you love it.
Cats believe 3 AM is the ideal time for hallway parkour.
A cat’s purr can mean 'I’m happy' or 'I’m plotting something.' There’s no middle ground.
Each cat’s nose print is unique, just like a human fingerprint.
Your cat thinks you’re a large, clumsy roommate who opens cans.
Cats have a natural instinct to sit in any box, bag, or suitcase that exists.
If a cat fits, it sits. And even if it doesn’t fit — it still sits.
Cats were once worshipped as gods, and they have not forgotten.
When cats stare at nothing, they’re probably seeing ghosts — or ignoring you.
Cats can dream — mostly about food, chaos, and world domination.
Cats’ whiskers are so sensitive they can detect tiny changes in air currents — and yet they still run into doors.
When your cat brings you a dead mouse, that’s their version of a gift card.
Cats believe gravity is optional and humans exist to refill bowls.
Cats will ignore you all day — then demand attention when you’re busiest.
Cats knock things over to test whether you’re paying attention.
A cat’s fur pattern is as unique as its personality — both equally unpredictable.
Cats purr not only when happy but also when healing themselves — tiny furry doctors!
Cats walk like supermodels — always as if someone’s watching.
Cats don’t follow rules. They *are* the rules.
When cats nap on your laptop, they’re saving you from working too much.
A cat’s tail language is complex — but the meaning is always 'I’m fabulous'.
Cats can jump up to six times their body length, mostly onto things they’re not supposed to.
Some cats have thumbs — because evolution wanted them to open treat jars eventually.
Cats think your 4 AM alarm is an amateur attempt at breakfast time.
Cats don’t meow to other cats — just to manipulate humans.
A cat’s favorite hobby is pretending to help you work.
Black cats were once feared — now they’re just fashion icons.
Cats chase laser pointers for exercise and existential frustration.
Cats use slow blinks to say 'you’re okay... for now'.
Cats don’t fetch because they’re management, not staff.
Cats love sitting on laundry — especially the white clothes.
Cats have retractable claws — stealth mode activated.
Cats believe every cardboard box is a luxury condo.
Cats can rotate their ears 180 degrees — perfect for ignoring you efficiently.
Cats rub against you to mark you as theirs — congratulations, you’re property.
Cats drink water by flicking their tongues at lightning speed — hydration with flair.
Cats love sunbeams like humans love Wi-Fi.
When cats sprint through the house at 3 AM, they’re fighting invisible demons — or boredom.
Cats love to sit exactly where you’re about to sit — because that’s their seat now.
Cats’ pupils adjust dramatically with light — and with drama.
Cats spend hours perfecting their fur, only to shed it all over you.
Your cat doesn’t hate you — they’re just disappointed in your life choices.
Cats can detect earthquakes before humans — but won’t warn you unless snacks are involved.
